Description: Upper body sherd (with turn of lip) of South Ionian pottery little master cup; interior: glazed reserved band at junction of lip and body; exterior: black on lip; dilute band near top of handle zone, in which there is a plastic panther (or lion) head with added red patch above and a red muzzle; added white and black on eyes; below, black.
Type series: Schlotzhauer Ionian Cup Type with application
Schlotzhauer little master Ionian Cup type
Curator's comments: Schlotzhauer identifies the sherd as belonging to the South Ionian cups with everted rim Type 9C. However, the curve of the shoulder and the curved junction of the rim and body suggest that the sherd might be better placed within his Type 9B group. For parallels regarding the decoration, see See Berlin 3678 from Rhodes (Samos 6.1, pl.42 no. 346).
Bibliographic references: Walter-Karydi 1973 / Samische Gefässe des 6. Jahrhunderts vor Christi: Landschaftsstile ostgriechischer Gefässe (p. 127, no. 348)
Schlotzhauer 2012 / Untersuchungen zur archaischen griechischen Keramik aus Naukratis (p. 52, no. 285, p. 113)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GE.759) (Phase 3)
